abstract: Creates regressor metrics describing the quality of your model.
overview:
## Discussion

You typically don’t initialize metrics directly. Instead you get metrics about your model after training. For example, when you train an [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLRegressor], you can look at its [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLRegressor/trainingMetrics] and [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLRegressor/validationMetrics] properties. Additionally, you can check the performance on a test set with the [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLRegressor/evaluation(on:)-7pirm] method.

# init(maximumError:rootMeanSquaredError:)

**Initializer**

Creates regressor metrics describing the quality of your model.

## Declaration

```swift
init(maximumError: Double, rootMeanSquaredError: Double)
```

## Parameters

- **maximumError**: The maximum error of the model for the training data.
- **rootMeanSquaredError**: The root mean squared error of the model for the training data.

## Discussion

You typically don’t initialize metrics directly. Instead you get metrics about your model after training. For example, when you train an [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLRegressor], you can look at its [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLRegressor/trainingMetrics] and [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLRegressor/validationMetrics] properties. Additionally, you can check the performance on a test set with the [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLRegressor/evaluation(on:)-7pirm] method.
title: init(maximumError:rootMeanSquaredError:)
